member.name: T:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.InvalidProjectFileException
member.summary: This exception is thrown whenever there is a problem with the user's XML project file. The problem might be semantic or syntactical. If the problem is in the syntax, it can typically be caught by XSD validation.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of class.

member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.

member.param: The exception that is the cause of the current excpetion. If the innerException parameter is not a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), the current exception is raised in a catch block that handles the inner exception.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of class using rich error information.

The XML node where the error is located. Can be null.
The error code. This parameter can be a null reference (Nothing).
A description for the error. This parameter can be a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
The error message text for the exception.

The error message text for the exception.
The error code. This parameter can be a null reference (Nothing).
The invalid column number in the project. Set to zero if not available.
The invalid project file. Can be an empty string.
The F1-help keyword for the host IDE. This parameter can be a null reference (Nothing).
The description of the error. This parameter can be a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

The invalid line number in the project. Set to zero if not available.

member.summary: Gets the invalid column number, if any, in the project.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.PropertyPosition

member.name: F:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.PropertyPosition.UseExistingOrCreateAfterLastImport
member.summary: Replace the existing Property element if it exists. Otherwise, create the Property after the last Import element in the project.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.PropertyPosition.UseExistingOrCreateAfterLastPropertyGroup
member.summary: Replace the existing Property element if it exists. Otherwise, if possible, create a new Property element as a child of an existing compatible PropertyGroup element. If necessary, create a new compatible PropertyGroup element immediately following the last PropertyGroup in the project.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.Target
member.summary: Represents a single Target element in an MSBuild project.
